thread.title: Schools roundup: Rockets honor Brock of ages
thread.title_full: Schools roundup: Rockets honor Brock of ages | Boston Herald

author: Kat Hasenauer Cornetta
title: Schools roundup: Rockets honor Brock of ages
text:
When Needham’s DeFazio Park originally was built, there wasn’t enough funding for a scoreboard or viewing stands at the Rockets’ new home for boys soccer games.
Yet, longtime Needham boys soccer coach Don Brock often longed for those extras.
Yesterday, prior to the Rockets’ game against visiting Bay State League foe Newton South , the field finally had a scoreboard and stands and the field was dedicated to Brock, who led one of the state’s powerhouse programs for 56 years until his retirement after suffering a stroke during the state tournament last season.
“I’m delighted to see a scoreboard on our field and some stands for our fans,” a beaming Brock said.
The field dedication was made possible by donations by Rockets soccer alumni and the Needham Soccer Club. Brock said he was humbled as at least 50 alumni turned out before the match to watch the unveiling ceremony.
“The best place in the world was on the field,” said Brock.
“He was the program for years,” said current Rockets coach Jimmy Odierna. “He brought the program to where it is today.”
The game that followed was a lesson in defense as Needham (8-1-4) played Newton South (4-5-2) to a 0-0 tie. The Rockets had several opportunities early, but then fell back and let the Lions use solid footwork to clog up the field.
Needham took the field for the second half with a much quicker tempo, but Newton South goalie Dan Epstein made three saves in the half to lead a stifling defense.
Boys soccer
In a Catholic Conference contest, Max Presutti and Christian Labect scored a goal apiece to lead BC High (6-3-1) past Catholic Memorial , 2-0.
In nonleague action, Brian Brennan and Josh Lang tallied a goal each as St. John’s Prep (4-3-4) outlasted Andover , 2-1.
Marcello Rossetti, Kevin Barrucci and Brian Roach contributed to this report.
